result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Jean Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melissa Jean Smith in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
  Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement

Defendant Melissa Jean Smith in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  ADA Jessica Behling is out sick and requesting a new court date.
Case is adjourned to 8-18-22 at 8:30 am for a DPA hearing by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Melissa Jean Smith in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melissa Jean Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Oral No Violent Contact Order with C.S. (dob 1/27/2009).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melissa Jean Smith in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/04/2022 @01:00pm
